p: The study was carried out following the process as referred by Duvey [ 20]. The extracts of Trachyspermum khasianum H. Wolff were evaluated for anthelmintic activity in Eisenia foetida (earthworms) [ 21]. The collected earthworms were first washed with distilled water and acclimatized at an ambient temperature 30 min before the experiment. Test samples of the extracts were prepared at different concentrations to include 10, 20, and 40 mg/ml [ 22]. Albendazole suspension was used as standard and distilled water was used as a control. The earthworms were divided into nine groups, each group was consisted of 5 earthworms. The earthworms were placed in Petri dishes containing the different concentrations of extract solution as well as the standard drug [ 23]. The chronological group arrangements are given as follows:
